name: Mandar
description: The Mandar are an ethnic group on the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia, with a strong seafaring and trading tradition. The sailors used stars and asterisms to pinpoint the cardinal directions. This sky culture has 6 constellation line figures, explicitly drawn with stars identified, so can be considered certain unless specified otherwise. The source also provides names for 3 other identified sky objects (the Pleiades, the Milky Way, and Venus), and the name of an unidentified sky object: Star of Fishermen or Bittoéng Pambosei, which is a marker towards the north and usually appears in February, during the northwest monsoon season. These constellations reflect the seafaring tradition. The Bugis sky culture is related (they are neighbouring ethnic groups on the island of Sulawesi) so it is similar.

constellations.description: Is used as an indicator for the south. Five stars (including Crux) form a house with uneven foundations.

constellations.certainty: Although the source doesn't link the two stars with a line, the equivalent Bugis data does. They are linked here.
constellations.description: A pair of stars just below the Slanted House, so also a sign for the south direction.

constellations.certainty: There is a triangular fin in the middle, and a tail at the back. The drawing in the source has a large open mouth, but the star for the back of the mouth is not identified (nor could we identify it), so none is included here (the mouth is instead closed).
constellations.description: Marks the entry of the northwest monsoon season.
Marks the entry of the northwest monsoon season. It consists of a head (with two eyes, which are not linked by lines to the head) and a tail.
Is used as an indicator of the entry of the cool season (between the two monsoons) and the appearance of the bambang fish. It consists of fishermen and a boat.

constellations.certainty: The stars are not linked into lines in the source, but are linked here, since they're described as being in line.
constellations.description: Two groups of stars that each have three stars in line. These stars are a mark towards the east from the Pleiades.

NAME Pleiades.description: Used as a sign of increasing number of flying fish in the Makassar Strait during the southeast monsoon season.

NAME Milky Way.description: Used by fishermen to find a good fishing location without strong winds.

NAME Venus.description: Used as a sign that the Sun will rise about an hour later.
Used by mountain people as a mark that pigs will come out looking for food.
